job_title: Resident Assistant in Le Mars, IA
pros: I love my job as it is rewarding and you get attached quickly to your consumers even though we are told not to. It’s kind of hard not to when you provide care for them. Easy job but can be demanding at times.
cons: All of the different “jobs” you have at a site doesn’t get compensated. They assist in paying for your further education but does not pay to want to keep you.

review_title: Associate at PRIDE Group, LLC, Tempe, AZ
pros: Lots of great people and diversity in the jobs.  Entry level can entertain a number of different positions at major venues in the Phoenix area!  There is lots of work in the winter and the weather is fabulous!
cons: Working outside in the summer in Arizona can be a challenge!

job_title: Habilitation Assistant in Le Mars, IA
pros: Working with the mentally disabled is rewarding work. The consumers are fantastic.
cons: They don't hire gays and if they accidentally do hire one their days are numbered once found out. I was fired 6 months after letting a pronoun slip when talking about my fiance. I had worked for a year with no corrective action and was one of only 2 employees to get a raise that year. Then suddenly I was being written up every 3 weeks for doing my job the same as I has always done.

pros: Management team is supportive and is being led in the right direction, with a direction that focuses on the clients. The growth in the clients are very evident and the atmosphere is positive. We are finally working as a team at the Lemars RCF. The atmosphere is fun and we help each other out from the top down.
cons: Would like more responsibility and cheaper benefits

job_title: Security Guard in El Mirage, AZ
pros: Work your own schedule, choose the special events you like to work.
cons: Little room for advancement, work availability in off months.
